lines.text: Ben, what did those Indians want?
They offered to buy you for those five horses.
Well, did you sell me?
Nope; held out for more horses.
[the family is trying to act normally while three Indians are waiting outside]
Dammit, Ben. We can kill them before we eat breakfast.
I've left my family. They've changed. Turned into Indian lovers; Injun lovers. I'm a little drunk, Georgia.
C'mon, Cash. You can sleep it off in the barn. There's a nice bed in my room if you'll marry me.
I might be drunk; but I ain't that drunk.
We come in peace.
My land. My sky. You are welcome.
Young horses. Good for fighting. Good for hunting. You take.
I am ashamed. I have nothing to offer you.
In house. You have woman. One our women.
Who told you this.
Old man. One your tribe. Carry long knife. He say you have one our women.
He is crazy.
Sun speak through him. Talk to dead people. He say woman your house my sister.
He lies. Woman my house white. Dahkoi. Father white, mother white. Burned to death by you; by Kiowa.
How many horses for woman?
There are not enough horses in the world. Not as many as you can catch. Not as many as you can steal.
[the Zachary's are trapped inside the house]
The only thing I hate is I never got to go to Wichita and have me...
[pauses and looks at Ma]
...that glass of beer.
[first lines]
[yelling at a cow eating grass growing on the Zachary family's roof]
Shoo now! Shoo! Ain't you got no better manners than to eat at the top of a house?
When the wind's in the right direction, I can smell Injun a mile off.
Well, I hate to disappoint you, but that smell is comin' off of me. I haven't changed my dirt since Wichita, Kansas.
[the Zacharys are discussing the rumors about Rachel]
It's out there, Ben. It's layin' on their stomachs and they don't know what to do.
Well, it's still a lie and we've got nothin' to be ashamed of.
What are we goin' to do when one of them says it? What are we goin' to do when one of them says it to Rachel?
Kill 'em, I guess.
That's all I wanted to hear.
[Charlie Rawlins has asked Ben for permission to marry Rachel]
Well, Ben; you ain't goin' to shoot Charlie now are you?
I'm thinkin' about it. If I wasn't so short-handed I might.
[Ma Zachary has finally admitted to the family that Rachel really is a Kiowa]

Your Pa brought the little Indian baby to me and put her in my arms. My own girl child with yellow curls had just died; too young to even have a name. My breasts were hurting with all that milk. So I gave the baby her name, Rachel. Rachel, my sweet beautiful Kiowa baby.
[Cash advocates killing the Kiowa outside of the house]
All right, Cash. Let's see if they're after our scalps first.
[shoots the top of one Indian's lance]
I'm going out to talk. Cash, if they break the peace, kill them.
When will that be?
When they kill me.
I could marry that handsome, winsome Charlie or that baby Jude. I could even marry you.
Watch you language, girl.
Well, why not? We're not cousins. We're not even relatives.
We're not even friends.
Get her out of here! I don't care how you do it, but get her out of here!
I'm stayin', Cash. She's stayin'. We're all stayin'.
I'm not stayin'. Not with a red-hide nigger!
